member.name: T:Json.Pointer.CharExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for .

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.CharExtensions.IsHexadecimal(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines if the char represents a hexadecimal value.
member.returns: `true` if the character is in the ranges `0-9`, `a-z`, or `A-Z`; `false` otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.CharExtensions.GetHexadecimalValue(System.Char)
member.summary: Translates the character to its hexadecimal numeric value.
member.exception: is not a valid hexadecimal character.

member.name: T:Json.Pointer.EnumerableExtensions
member.summary: More extensions on .

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.EnumerableExtensions.GetCollectionHashCode``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Gets a collection-oriented hash code by combining the hash codes of its elements.
member.returns: A singular integer value that represents the collection.
member.remarks: This can be used to correctly compare the contents of collections.

member.name: T:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer
member.summary: Represents a JSON Pointer IAW RFC 6901.

member.summary: The empty pointer.

member.name: P:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Segments
member.summary: Gets the collection of pointer segments.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a JSON Pointer from a string.
member.exception: does not contain a valid pointer or contains a pointer of the wrong kind.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.TryParse(System.String,Json.Pointer.JsonPointer@)
member.summary: Parses a JSON Pointer from a string.
member.returns: `true` if the parse was successful; `false` otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Create(Json.Pointer.PointerSegment[])
member.summary: Creates a new JSON Pointer from a collection of segments.
member.remarks: This method creates un-encoded pointers only.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Create(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Json.Pointer.PointerSegment})
member.summary: Creates a new JSON Pointer from a collection of segments.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Create``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,System.Object}},Json.Pointer.PointerCreationOptions)
member.summary: Generates a JSON Pointer from a lambda expression.
member.param: The lambda expression which gives the pointer path.
member.exception: Thrown when the lambda expression contains a node that is not a property access or -valued indexer.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Combine(Json.Pointer.JsonPointer)
member.summary: Concatenates a pointer onto the current pointer.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Combine(Json.Pointer.PointerSegment[])
member.summary: Concatenates additional segments onto the current pointer.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Evaluate(System.Text.Json.JsonElement)
member.summary: Evaluates the pointer over a .
member.returns: The sub-element at the pointer's location, or null if the path does not exist.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.TryEvaluate(System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode@)
member.summary: Evaluates the pointer over a .
member.param: The result, if return value is true; null otherwise
member.returns: true if a value exists at the indicate path; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.ToString(Json.Pointer.JsonPointerStyle)
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.
member.param: Indicates whether to URL-encode the pointer.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Equals(Json.Pointer.JsonPointer)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.
member.returns: true if the current object is equal to the other parameter; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.
member.param: The object to compare with the current instance.
member.returns: true if obj and this instance are the same type and represent the same value; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.op_Equality(Json.Pointer.JsonPointer,Json.Pointer.JsonPointer)
member.summary: Evaluates equality via .
member.returns: `true` if the pointers are equal; `false` otherwise.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.JsonPointer.op_Inequality(Json.Pointer.JsonPointer,Json.Pointer.JsonPointer)
member.summary: Evaluates inequality via .
member.returns: `false` if the pointers are equal; `true` otherwise.

member.name: T:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolver
member.summary: Declares a property name resolution which is used to provide a property name.

member.name: T:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers
member.summary: Defines a set of predefined property name resolution methods.

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.AsDeclared
member.summary: Makes no changes. Properties are generated with the name of the property in code.

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.CamelCase
member.summary: Property names to camel case (e.g. `camelCase`).

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.PascalCase
member.summary: Property names to pascal case (e.g. `PascalCase`).

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.SnakeCase
member.summary: Property names to snake case (e.g. `Snake_Case`).

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.UpperSnakeCase
member.summary: Property names to upper snake case (e.g. `UPPER_SNAKE_CASE`).

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.KebabCase
member.summary: Property names to kebab case (e.g. `Kebab-Case`).

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.PropertyNameResolvers.UpperKebabCase
member.summary: Property names to upper kebab case (e.g. `UPPER-KEBAB-CASE`).

member.name: T:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer
member.summary: Represents a Relative JSON Pointer IAW draft-handrews-relative-json-pointer-02

member.name: F:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.Null
member.summary: The null pointer. Indicates no navigation should occur.

member.name: P:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.IsIndexQuery
member.summary: Gets whether the pointer is an index query, which returns the index within the parent rather than the value.

member.name: P:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.ParentSteps
member.summary: Gets the number of parent (root) steps to take.

member.name: P:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.ArrayIndexManipulator
member.summary: Gets the number of lateral steps to take. Applicable only for arrays.

member.name: P:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.Pointer
member.summary: Gets the pointer to follow after taking steps upward.

member.summary: Creates an index query pointer.

member.name: M:Json.Pointer.RelativeJsonPointer.IndexQuery(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an index query pointer.

member.summary: Creates a Relative JSON Pointer from a JSON Pointer and a number of parent steps.

member.summary: Creates a Relative JSON Pointer from a JSON Pointer and a number of parent steps.

member.exception: does not contain a valid relative pointer.

member.summary: Parses a JSON Pointer from a string.
member.returns: `true` if the parse was successful; `false` otherwise.

member.summary: Evaluates the relative pointer over a .

member.returns: true if a value exists at the indicate path; false otherwise.
